Submodules¶

cage.core module¶

class cage.core.Cage(species, coords, charge=0, spin_multiplicity=None, validate_proximity=False, site_properties=None)[source]¶

Bases: pymatgen.core.structure.Molecule

A Cage is a pymatgen.Molecule-based object for molecules shaped similar to fullerenes.

anion_center¶
append(species, coords, validate_proximity=True, properties=None)[source]¶

Overwrite the append method of the Molecule class, in order to reset the facets, symmetry operations and point group after the site has been appended.

Note: Running this method will reset the facets and symmetry information to None.

Parameters:
  • species (pymatgen.Specie) – Species of inserted site.
  • coords ((3,) numpy.ndarray) – Coordinates of inserted site.
  • validate_proximity (bool) – Whether to check if inserted site is too close to an existing site. Defaults to True.
  • properties (dict) – A dictionary of properties for the Site.
center(point=None)[source]¶

Center the Cage around a point by updating the sites, i.e. find the coordinates for the sites so that the geometric center is on the point provided. In case no point is provided, the molecule is centered around the origin.

Note: Running this method will reset the facets and symmetry information to None.

Parameters:point ((3,) numpy.ndarray) – Point around which to center the molecule.
copy()[source]¶

Convenience method to get a copy of the Cage. Overwritten from the Molecule class to conserve the charge of the molecule.

Returns:cage.core.Cage
facets¶

Surface Facets of the Cage. Note that in case the surface facets have not been set up using find.surface.facets(), the property is equal to None.

Returns:
The surface facets of the Cage, as set up using
find_surface_facets()
Return type:(List of Facets)
find_closest_facet(point)[source]¶

Find the Facet of the Molecule that is the closest to the point provided.

Parameters:point ((3,) numpy.ndarray) – Point provided by user.
Returns:(cage.Facet)
find_facet_links(share_edge=False)[source]¶

Find the non-equivalent links between facets of the cage molecule. The facets can be connected by sharing an edge, or a site.

Parameters:
  • share_edge (bool) – Only return links between facets that
  • an edge. (share) –
Returns:

(List of (cage.Facet, cage.Facet) Tuples) - The

non-equivalent facet links of the Cage.
find_farthest_facet(point)[source]¶

Find the Facet of the Molecule that is the farthest away from the point provided.

Parameters:point ((3,) numpy.ndarray) – Point provided by user.
Returns:(cage.Facet)
find_noneq_chain_links(facets=<class 'tuple'>, symm_tol=0.01, verbose=False)[source]¶

Find the links between the facets of the chain that connects a set of non equivalent facets.

Parameters:
  • facets (tuple) – Tuple of Facets which are to be used for the chain. In case no facets are provided, the full list of non-equivalent facets will be used.
  • symm_tol (float) – Tolerance for the equivalence condition, i.e. how much the distance between the centers is allowed to be after a symmetry operation.
  • verbose (bool) – Print information about the analysis procedure. This is mainly useful when the result is not as expected.
Returns:

(List of (cage.Facet, cage.Facet) Tuples) –

The links between the Facets in the chain of non-equivalent Facets.
find_noneq_facet_chain(start=0, facets=<class 'tuple'>, symm_tol=0.01, verbose=False)[source]¶

Construct a chain of facets, i.e. a collection of facets that are connected by edges. Automatically sorts the facets so they are connected by their neighbours in the list.

Parameters:
  • start (int) – Determines from which termination facet the chain is constructed. This might be useful if the chain is not constructed as the user would like.
  • facets (tuple) – Tuple of Facets which are to be used for the chain. In case no facets are provided, the list of non-equivalent facets will be used.
  • symm_tol (float) – Tolerance for the equivalence condition, i.e. how much the distance between the centers is allowed to be after a symmetry operation.
  • verbose (bool) – Print information about the analysis procedure. This is mainly useful when the result is not as expected.
Returns:

(List of Facets) – A chain of facets connected by sharing an

edge.
find_noneq_facets(tol=0.01)[source]¶

Find the nonequivalent facets of the Cage.

Parameters:tol (float) – Tolerance for the equivalence condition, i.e. how much the distance between the centers is allowed to be after a symmetry operation.
Returns:A set of non-equivalent facets of the Cage.
Return type:List of Facets
find_surface_facets(ignore=())[source]¶

Find all the surface facets of the Cage object. A surface facet is defined as a facet for which all atoms of non-ignored species are on one side of the surface defined by the facet.

Currently does not expand the facets to 4 sites in case it finds other sites which are in the plane of the site, as defined by 3 site points.

Parameters:ignore (Tuple of Elements/Species) – The elements to ignore for the surface facet determination.
classmethod from_molecule(mol)[source]¶

Initializes a Cage from a Molecule.

Parameters:mol (pymatgen.Molecule) – The molecule from which to initialize the cage.
Returns:(cage.Cage)
classmethod from_poscar(filename)[source]¶

Imports a Cage from a VASP POSCAR file.

Parameters:filename (string) – Filename of the POSCAR file.
Returns:(cage.Cage)
insert(index, species, coords, validate_proximity=True, properties=None)[source]¶

Overwrite the insert method of the Molecule class, in order to reset the facets, symmetry operations and point group after the site has been inserted.

Note: Running this method will reset the facets and symmetry information to None.

Parameters:
  • index (int) – Index to insert site.
  • species (pymatgen.Specie) – Species of inserted site.
  • coords ((3,) numpy.ndarray) – Coordinates of inserted site.
  • validate_proximity (bool) – Whether to check if inserted site is too close to an existing site. Defaults to True.
  • properties (dict) – A dictionary of properties for the Site.
pointgroup¶

The Schoenflies PointGroup of the Cage molecule.

Returns:(pymatgen.symmetry.analyzer.PointGroup)
redefine_origin(origin)[source]¶

Change the coordinates of the Cage, in order to redefine the origin.

Note: Running this method will reset the facets and symmetry information to None.

Parameters:origin ((3,) numpy.ndarray) – Origin coordinates.
set_up_facet_list(fmt='dict', tol=0.01)[source]¶

Set up a List of the surface facets, and how they relate to the non-equivalent facets, i.e. which non-equivalent facet they can be related to and using which symmetry operation:

noneq_facet = symmop(facet)

Parameters:
  • fmt (str) –

    Format of the Facet List. Can be either:

    dict – A dictionary with the facets as keys and the tuple (noneq_facet, symmop) as the values.

    str_array – A structured array of type:
    [(‘surf_facet’, Facet), (‘noneq_facet’, Facet), (‘symmop’, SymmOp)]
  • tol (float) – Tolerance for the equivalence condition, i.e. how much the distance between the centers is allowed to be after a symmetry operation.
Returns:

(List of cage.Facets) – The list of facets with their

corresponding non-equivalent facet and symmetry operation. See the fmt argument.
symmops¶

The symmetry operations of the Cage.

Returns:(List of pymatgen.Symmop)
to_poscar(filename='POSCAR')[source]¶

Writes the Cage to a POSCAR file.

visualize_facets(filename, ignore=(), max_bond_length=1.9)[source]¶

Visualize the facets of the Cage by setting up a VESTA file with the various facets in different colours and with the corresponding index given to the atom, labeled ‘Fa’ placed at the center of the facet.

Parameters:filename (str) – Name of the VESTA file to be written.

Bases: pymatgen.core.structure.SiteCollection, monty.json.MSONable

Add a site to the facet. Will only work in case the site is in the surface defined by the facet.

get_normal_intersection(other)[source]¶

Find the intersection of the normal lines of the Facet and another one.

Currently only works on an edge sharing Facet whose normal intersects with the normal of the facet. In case the normals do not intersect, an approximation is given.

Parameters:other (cage.Facet) – Facet which shares an edge with this one.
Returns:
(numpy.ndarray) – (3,) Numpy array of the intersection
coordinates.
is_equivalent(other, symmops, tol=0.01)[source]¶

Check if a Facet is equivalent to another Facet based on a list of symmetry operations.

Parameters:
  • other (cage.Facet) – Facet with which to compare the Facet.
  • symmops (list) – List of pymatgen.Symmop instances which are used to determine equivalency.
  • tol (float) – Tolerance for the equivalence condition, i.e. how much the distance between the centers is allowed to be after a symmetry operation.
Returns:

(bool) - Whether or not the facet is equivalent to the other

facet.
normal¶

Surface normal of the Facet :return: Array of the normal vector

redefine_origin(origin)[source]¶

Adjust the coordinates of the Facet, in order to redefine the origin.

Parameters:origin (numpy.ndarray) – (3,) Numpy array of the new origin’s coordinates.
sites¶

The sites that define the Facet. :return: List of Sites

Write the Facet to a file.

Currently support only the ‘json’ format.

  • fmt (str) – Format of the file.
  • filename (str) – Name of the file to which the facet should be written.
class cage.core.OccupiedCage(species, coords, charge=0, spin_multiplicity=None, validate_proximity=False, site_properties=None)[source]¶

Bases: cage.core.Cage

A Cage Molecule that has one or more cations docked on it.

CATIONS = (Element Li, Element Na, Element K, Element Mg)¶
add_dock(dock, cation=None, docking_point=None)[source]¶

Add a docking site to the OccupiedCage. If the chemical symbol of the cation is provided, the cation is appended to the OccupiedCage. In case the cation is equal to None, the cation is assumed to be present and the facet is simply designated as a dock.

Note: If a cation is appended to the molecule. running this method will reset the facets and symmetry information to None.

Parameters:
  • dock (cage.Facet) – The Facet on which the cation is docked.
  • cation (str) – The chemical symbol of the cation element.
  • docking_point ((3,) numpy.ndarray) – Docking coordinates of the cation.
center(point=None)[source]¶

Center the OccupiedCage around a point by updating the sites, i.e. find the coordinates for the sites so that the geometric center of the anion is moved to the point provided. In case no point is provided, the anion is centered around the origin.

Note: Running this method will reset the facets and symmetry information to None.

Parameters:point ((3,) numpy.ndarray) – Point around which to center the molecule.
docks¶
facets¶

Surface Facets of the Cage. Note that in case the surface facets have not been set up using find.surface.facets(), the property is equal to None.

Returns:
The surface facets of the Cage, as set up using
find_surface_facets()
Return type:(List of Facets)
find_surface_facets(ignore=None)[source]¶

Find the surface facets of the OccupiedCage, minus the facets which have a docked cation.

Parameters:ignore (Tuple of Elements/Species) – The elements to ignore for the surface facet determination.
classmethod from_cage_and_facets(cage, facets, docking_points=(), cation='Li')[source]¶

Initialize an OccupiedCage from a Cage object and a tuple of facets.

Parameters:
  • cage (cage.Cage) – The anion on which the cations are docked.
  • facets (tuple) – Tuple of cage.Facets on which the cations are docked.
  • docking_points (tuple) – Tuple of (3,) numpy.ndarray coordinates that define the docking coordinates of the corresponding docking Facets.
  • cation (str) – Chemical symbol of the cation. In case None is given, the docking sites are considered to already have a cation present.
Returns:

(cage.OccupiedCage)

change_center(center)[source]¶

extend_by_rotation(axis, density=10.0, remove_endline=False, distance_tol=0.001)[source]¶

Extends the landscape using an axis vector and turning all the vertices in the landscape around the origin by a value and direction determined by the axis vector.

Parameters:
  • axis (numpy.ndarray) – Axis around which the landscape is
  • The length of the vector determines the total rotation (rotated.) –
  • in radians. (angle) –
  • density (float) – Density of grid points along the rotation
  • Defined in #grid points per radians. (angle.) –
  • remove_endline (bool) – Include the final rotation angle grid
  • points. –
  • distance_tol (float) – Minimum distance between two points in
  • landscape. (the) –

class cage.landscape.LandscapeAnalyzer(data, datapoints=(), software='nwchem')[source]¶

Bases: monty.json.MSONable

An analyzer class for interpreting data from calculations on a landscape.

analyze_cation_energies(coordinates, reference=None, cation='Li')[source]¶

Extract the total energies for all the calculations, and connect them with the proper coordinates. Currently supports the following landscapes for analysis:

Interfacet wedges: 2D landscapes that connect two Facets via a wedge. Polar coordinates are used to plot this landscape, and the program needs a reference axis to determine an appropriate angle.

Spherical landscapes:

Returns:

class cage.path.Path(site_collections)[source]¶

Bases: object

A Path is defined by a List of SiteCollections.

barrier¶

Size of the energy barrier along the path. This is defined as the largest energy minus the initial energy. Expressed in eV.

Returns:

energies¶
